result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominique D Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA surcharge to be paid through collection by the DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
**Restitution set at Zero**

Concurrent with: With any other sentence defendant is currently serving. (will be served in prison)
Court advised defendant  that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until this civil rights are restored.
As a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominique D Taylor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA / SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (28 pages) commencing JULY 2, 2015, received and filed.  jm

Defendant Dominique D Taylor in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Dominique D Taylor in custody.  Lucy Kronforst for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant sentenced to serve 1 YEAR at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION (will be served in prison), concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving. 
Credit for 157 days time served.

COURT ORDERS:
* Defendant to provide DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge.    The Court ordered that DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given. 

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Dominique D Taylor in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Dominique D Taylor in custody.  Lucy Kronforst for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM GREEN BAY FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 2.

Attorney Mark Lipscomb in court, Defendant Dominique D Taylor not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADA James Griffin appeared TELEPHONICALLY for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT in court; in custody.

Parties unable to proceed with a scheduling conference today.
Attorney for the defendant, Mark Lipscomb, does NOT appear.
Case adjourned to 06-26-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Scheduling Conference.
ORDER TO PRODUCE, THURSDAY, JUNE 25, 2015 8:30 A.M.,  BR2 RM 635. kl

Attorney Mark Lipscomb in court, defendant Dominique D Taylor not in court, in custody.  Timothy Cotter for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for status of counsel.
Atty. Mark Lipscomb is now the attorney of record.
Case adjourned to 06-25-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Scheduling Conference.

Defendant Dominique D Taylor in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Kastenson's motion to withdraw heard and GRANTED.
Atty. Daryl Kastenson is now discharged.
Case adjourned to 06-08-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status of Counsel.

Defendant Dominique D Taylor in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Dominique D Taylor in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon the Court going through the plea colloquy, based upon some of the defendant's responses Court cannot find a factual basis to accept the plea at this time.
Court adjourns this matter to give defense an opportunity to go over the video discovery and defendant's plea questionnaire again.
Case adjourned to 05-20-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Dominique D Taylor not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 04-16-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  
Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.

Defendant Dominique D Taylor in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Dominique D Taylor in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Pocan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Donald, Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jacob D

Defendant Dominique D Taylor in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Dominique D Taylor in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Dominique D Taylor
Current: 1918 W State Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 02-03-2015)
Prior: House Of Corrections  8885 South 68th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53132
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
